comments:
Got the following trace during smoke testing of the Apr 26 Ibuild candidate.  Note that this trace is not being properly logged, but instead is dumped to console error:
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceException: Resource '/TestJSF1/beans/Login.java' does not exist.

*** Bug 188469 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 189332 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 193706 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Hari, bug 193706 has a proposed fix for this (and another), but it isn't attached as a patch.  Yaron states:

I suggest the following patches :
1) org.eclipse.wst.validation.internal.TaskListUtility, line 62
   add || !resource.exists() to the "IF" statement to verify that 
   the file really exists.
2) org.eclipse.wst.validation.internal.ValidatorMetaData, line 349
   add && ((IFile)resource).exists() . Again, to verify that the file 
   really exists.

I just check and it fixes the error exception that was thrown.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 189126 ***
